intro: Lepidium desvauxii var. hookeri, commonly known as Hooker's cress, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers and its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
